text:
Hello everyone, I am facing a CSS loading issue in the header navigation menus. When the page loads or is hard-refreshed, the menus are initially appearing shrunk, but after some time they show up in their exact position. Please check the screenshot below. How can I fix this?

<https://i.ibb.co/ZVVf5jK/Group-2585.png>
do you have a page link? seeing the code would be helpful
This quotes tool is straight up busted... It dies on e-signature and my client is angry and I have no clue as to why it's breaking.
support has been abysmal and the situation is getting dire

Thanks Jennifer
Below link of the website 
<https://scalestation.io/|https://scalestation.io/>
Hey <@U055P74DLDB>, not sure if support already mentioned this, but are you using a custom font on your quote template? This can cause some issues with the e-sign.
It would require a much deeper dive into your header code to understand how you have it coded, but I think you need to look at other options for controlling the position as a starting point

Okay thanks Jennifer
Also you have seen the padding or margin also not worked on load page or hard refreshed the page.
<@U02NJACH5QS> YOU RULE. I have been hitting a dead end with this for 3 weeks and this is a fresh lead that smells right!!!!
I'm gonna turn off all custom fonts here in a few hours! Thanks so much for this idea
using hsDebug I was able to see the shrunken/moved menu - where it was shifting up to the upper left and reducing the size and padding, which sounds like what you are seeing

Hey <@U03AKL6Q1B2>
I changed some CSS for the position but its still same issue with menus from the initial load or hard refreshed the page.

I didn't create the header myself. Its done by other developer, so I'm unable to identify the exact problem with the menus.
